manifest.author: Envy Development Team
manifest.prompt: Click here to select English as your natural language.

label.tip: Seek to a position in the media file
Seek to a position in the media file

document.name: CHomeViewCtrl

group.heading: Get Connected
group.text: You are not currently connected to any peer-to-peer networks.

group.heading: Search for Files
Start a Download
group.text: downloading a new file or torrent link.

group.heading: Warning: You Are Firewalled
group.text: Envy has detected that you are hidden behind a router or firewall, and are unable to receive active connections from the Internet.
This may cause poor download and search performance.
group.link: learn how to configure your router.

group.heading: Warning: Your TCP Port Is Firewalled
group.text: Envy has detected that you are behind a NAT router or firewall, and are unable to receive TCP connections from the Internet.
This may cause poor download performance.
group.link: learn how to configure your router.

group.heading: Warning: Your UDP Port Is Firewalled
group.text: Envy has detected that you are behind a NAT router or firewall, and are unable to receive UDP messages from the Internet.
This may cause poor search performance.
group.link: learn how to configure your router.

document.heading: Customize Envy
document.text: - Mix'n'match changes to visual appearances
- Set automated tasks to occur at specific times
- Update blocklist to avoid bad search results
- Quick-edit Envy's basic settings
- Get online support using Envy, or try
- Go to your English language forum

group.text: Control Envy using your web browser at:

document.name: CGeneralSettingsGroup
document.title: General
document.text: Welcome to Envy's Settings Manager
These option pages allow users to customize how Envy works. Settings in the
General
section relate to user experience.
Adjust common user interface behaviors, etc.
File access, and management of your local library.
Set when to use the internal Envy Media System.
Public chatroom connection settings and display options.
Your profile and direct chat settings.
Set Envy to be controlled from a web browser.
Enable your web browser to use Envy for peer-to-peer links and as general download manager.

document.name: CInternetSettingsGroup
document.title: Internet
document.text: Welcome to Envy's Settings Manager
These option pages allow users to customize how Envy works. Settings in the
Internet
section relate to connectivity (speeds).
Indicate speed and capabilities of your internet access.
Manage bandwidth-in, limits, and folder locations.
Manage bandwidth-out, limits, and queues.
Find Task Scheduler, Security Filters, Traffic Graphs, and more from the Advanced View menu.

document.name: CBrowseHostProfile.2
document.text: Shared Files

document.name: DownloadHelp.Select
document.text: Downloads Area
This is where files currently being downloaded are displayed. You can view individual sources by expanding each file with the small toggle to the left.
Drag'n'Drop downloads higher in the list for priority, or onto Download Group tabs for better organization (in Power Mode).
You can also use this command to get help information on a specific download. Simply select a download and choose this Help command again.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Seeding
document.text: This Torrent is Seeding
Envy has verified this complete download, and is actively sharing it with other downloaders through BitTorrent. Share 100% before closing.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Completed
document.text: This Download has Completed
Envy has finished downloading this file, and has verified that it is 100% correct. It has also moved the file to your downloads folder.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Moving
document.text: This Download is Moving
Envy has finished downloading this file, and has verified that it is correct. It is currently being moved and/or unpacked to your downloads folder.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Paused
document.text: This Download is Paused
You have paused this download. If you want it to resume downloading, you can click the '
Resume Download
' command.

document.name: DownloadHelp.DiskFull
document.text: The Disk is Full

Envy has paused this download automatically because the hard disk appears to be full, or the download file cannot be written to. If you wish to continue downloading, please free some space on your hard disk and/or check to make sure the incomplete file folder is accessible, and then resume the download.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Verifying
document.text: This Download is Verifying
This download has finished, and Envy is now checking it to ensure that it is exactly the same as the original file. If any damaged parts are found, Envy will repair them automatically.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Downloading
document.text: This Download is Active
This download is currently in progress. If it is downloading too slowly, you could try searching the network for more sources with the '
Find More Sources
' command. If the speed does not improve it may be due to limited upload speeds of the users you are downloading from. Download speed usually increases over time.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Pending
document.text: This Download is Pending

This download is waiting for someone to start uploading. Envy is ready to start downloading this file, but no-one is sending it at the moment. You are probably waiting in other user's queues, and the download may start transferring at any time. You can examine the individual sources to see each queue you are waiting in. If you are sharing files yourself, it may improve the chances of a download transfer starting quickly.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Queued
document.text: This Download is Queued

This download is waiting for some of your other downloads to complete. Your download settings limit the number of downloads which may be active at any given time, to ensure that each download gets a good share of the available bandwidth. You can change these settings via Tools, Envy Settings. Alternatively, you may manually start this download with the resume command.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Searching
document.text: This Download is Searching

There are no known sources for this download, so Envy is searching all connected P2P networks for new sources. Once sources are found, the download will start automatically. Envy searches for sources automatically, however you can speed up the process using the
Find More Sources
command.

Unfortunately in many cases there may be no users online who have the file you are looking for. The only course of action here is to wait for someone to come online, or cancel it and try to find a similar file which is more widely available.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Creating
document.text: This Download is Creating
Envy is pre-allocating a file in which to store this download, to save time later.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Tracker
document.text: BitTorrent Tracker Down
The BitTorrent tracker server for this download appears to be down or malfunctioning. Envy is unable to contact it to receive a list of peers.

document.name: UploadHelp
document.text: Uploads Area
This is where queues and uploads are displayed. You can expand each queue with the small + on the left, and filter what is displayed with the button on the right of the window's toolbar.

document.name: GeneralHelp.DiskSpace
document.text: Disk Space is Low
The amount of free space on one or more drives used by Envy is low.

You should always attempt to keep a reasonable amount of disk space free. Programs can become unstable if the drives become full, and temporary files may be lost. You should run a disk clean-up, delete unwanted files, or uninstall software you no longer need.

document.name: GeneralHelp.DiskWriteFail
document.text: A Required Directory is Non-writable
A disk or directory Envy needs cannot be written to.
A network drive may have been disconnected, or you may not have write permission to a selected directory. Please check directories and permissions, or change the temporary files location.

document.name: GeneralHelp.ConnectionFail
document.text: Internet Connection Has Been Lost
Windows reports that there is no internet connection is available.
It is likely that a modem or router has dropped, meaning the internet cannot be accessed. You may need to manually re-connect or reset your connection.
Envy has ceased connection attempts to avoid losing all cached hosts.

document.name: GeneralHelp.AdultFilter
document.text: Adult content filter enabled
Please note that (as with any automated filter) it may not be 100% effective at screening content. It is designed simply to filter out excess unwanted results, rather than as a 100% safe block.
Children's Internet use (including P2P file sharing) should always be under parental supervision.

document.name: GeneralHelp.BadTorrentEncoding
document.text: Torrent encoding error detected
Windows has reported a 'translation fault' while decoding text in this torrent. The .torrent file may be corrupt, or just incorrectly encoded.
The target file itself can most likely still be downloaded.

document.name: GeneralHelp.DonkeyServerList
document.text: Your eDonkey server list is empty
There are no servers in your eDonkey server list. You need to download an up to date server list (met file) to connect to ED2K.
You can download a server list from the ed2k setting page, or the discovery services window. (Press F9 to open the discovery services window)

document.name: GeneralHelp.UploadWarning
document.text: Limiting uploads may slow downloads
Several networks Envy connects to enforce ratios, limit uploads to clients that do not share, or simply preference uploading to known sharers.

Fortunately, broadband DSL connections are like a two-lane highway: you have separate allocations for upload and download. If your client is properly configured, you should be able to upload at a good rate while retaining full download capacity.
By default, your upload limit is set to about 85% of available upstream bandwidth, while downloads are unlimited. That configuration should give you the fastest possible downloads that are available.

document.name: SearchHelp.BadSearch1
document.text: Please re-phrase the search

This search is poorly formatted, and may not function correctly. Searches should include several terms where possible, and should specify a schema (file type). Furthermore, searches must not be limited to numbers or negative terms only, and you should avoid overly general queries.
Most clients on the network will ignore a search for all MP3 files, for example, because it is not specific enough, and would generate too many results.

document.name: SearchHelp.BadSearch2
document.text: Please re-phrase the search
This search does not contain enough terms to function properly. All searches need a minimum number of valid, alphabetic characters to be able to start.

While common file extensions (and numbers) can be searched for, you must enter other terms as well when creating the search. Punctuation and wildcards are not used in searches, just the text you enter.

document.name: SearchHelp.BadSearch3
document.text: Please re-phrase the search
This search seems to contain only common filetypes, or no searchable words.
If you are having trouble creating searches, keep in mind that it's quite similar to a web search. Specific terms or phrases are best- Unique names, titles and keywords.
General terms cannot be searched for efficiently and may result in poor search performance, as well as high bandwidth use during searches.
Further help is available on the Envy web site.

document.name: SearchHelp.AdultSearch
document.text: This search cannot be started
The specified search would likely return a large number of results with adult content, and this option has been turned off. You should either re-phrase the search, or disable the filter.
To disable the filter, go into Tools > Settings > General and uncheck the adult content filter.

document.name: ShareHelp.AlreadyShared
document.text: Already Shared
The folder you have selected is already being shared as part of an existing share.
%s

document.name: ShareHelp.BadShare
document.text: This folder should not be shared
This location is a protected system folder, or contains one.
Sharing this folder is not recommended.
Folders such as the Windows directory or Program Files do not usually contain files suitable for sharing. Any files of interest would be in sub-folders located
inside
these folders. Please share those instead.
The Envy 'incomplete' folder also should not be shared directly.

This setting has no effect on current downloads, or torrents, or with eDonkey hash and eDonkey network enabled. However, this setting is not ignored if the download is paused.{n}{n}ATTENTION: Use this option only if necessary, if you abuse the option you may be banned.

string.text: This is a pre-release version of Envy, and the beta testing period has ended. Please download the full, official release from http://getenvy.com.
The file "%s" has not yet been hashed. Please wait for the file to be hashed, and then try again.

This option uses services provided by bitprints.getenvy.com for recognising and sharing information about selected files.

Envy will transmit the SHA1 hash code for the selected files in order to query the Bitprints database. If you are concerned about privacy, you may wish to consult the bitprints.getenvy.com privacy policy.

Would you like to proceed?
Browse host %s responded with an unrecognised response, and may not support user/host browsing.
Unable to connect to host to browse user.
Unable to initiate a connection to %s to browse user.
Unable to send a push request to %s to browse user.
Initiating a connection to %s to browse user...
Browse user connection to %s was dropped.
Browse host %s responded with an invalid HTTP response.
Unable to download file listing. This host may not support browsing.
Error decoding Gnutella packets from browse host %s.
Sent a push request, waiting for connection...
Sent a push request to %s to browse user.
Closing browse user connection %s due to lack of traffic.
Incoming connection from %s is a BitTorrent coupling, negotiating...
Timed out connecting to BitTorrent client %s.
BitTorrent coupling with %s not accepted, a connection to this client already exists.
BitTorrent coupling with %s is extended protocol, identified "%s".
Timed out handshaking with BitTorrent client %s.
BitTorrent coupling with %s not accepted, maximum connections reached.

BitTorrent coupling with %s requested an unknown file.
BitTorrent coupling with %s responded with the wrong file.
BitTorrent coupling with %s failed because the remote client has a different Peer ID.
Closing BitTorrent coupling with %s due to lack of traffic.
The torrent "%s" is already on your download list, and cannot be seeded.
An error occurred while copying from "%s" to a BitTorrent share file.
Unable to create BitTorrent share file "%s".
An unknown error occurred while trying to seed "%s".
Error loading the torrent file "%s". This may not be a valid torrent.
This torrent includes the file "%s", but Envy cannot find this file in your library. If possible, move the file to the same folder as the torrent and try again.
This torrent includes the file "%s" which should be %s, however your version of the file is %s.
An error was detected in the file "%s".
Tracker failed- Trying next tracker (%i of %i)
You have changed the tracker URL for this torrent. Are you sure you want to save this change?\n\nAn invalid tracker URL may prevent further downloading.
Received BitTorrent tracker response for "%s", %i new sources.
Unable to parse prefetched BitTorrent file "%s".
Accepted incoming chat request from %s, handshaking...
Unable to create a connection to %s.
Unable to request a push connection from %s, no route available.
Handshake failed, host may not support chatting.
You have not yet filled in your user profile. You must provide a profile before you can chat with other users.\n\nWould you like to fill in your profile now?
Cannot send message, you are not connected. Envy is trying to connect...
Cannot send message, a connection has not been established yet.
Private conversation granted, you are now chatting with %s.
%s is not accepting private conversations, sorry.
Requesting a firewalled push connection from %s...
Connection failed due to invalid data on the wire.

Received a faulty push connection from %s, closing connection.
Boosting download "%s" by removing bandwidth caps.

Are you sure you want to cancel/abort every download in this group?
Closing download connection to %s, no longer required.
Download host %s sent unsolicited data, closing connection.
Are you sure you want to clear "%s"?\n\nOnce a download has been cleared from the Downloads window, it cannot be resumed later.
Are you sure you want to clear all paused downloads? Once a download has been cleared from the Downloads window, it cannot be resumed.
Are you sure you want to delete the download "%s"?
Initiating a connection to %s port %i to download "%s"...
Unable to connect to download host %s.
Aborting download of "%s" from %s (%s), network disabled.
The selected download currently has an active Task, please wait.
Please enter a valid range to erase. The "from" field is the first byte to erase, the "last" field is the last byte to erase.
You have typed a %s hash value, however it is invalid. Please check it and try again.
You have provided a %s hash value that is different from the one currently associated with this download. Are you sure you want to change the %s hash now?
You have made changes to the name field. Are you sure you want to rename this download?
You have made changes to the file size. Are you sure you want to change the file size for this download?

You cannot assume this download is complete and reverify it because you do not yet have any partial verification data, such as tiger-tree volume, eDonkey hashset or BitTorrent hashset. Without verification information the download cannot be reverified.

Are you sure you want to assume this download is complete and reverify it? The whole file will be considered, and Envy will accept parts which pass verification and redownload parts which fail verification.
Are you sure you want to forget the current verification status? All downloaded data will be treated as untrusted, and cached hashtrees and hashsets will be flushed.
Are you sure you want to forget all sources for the selected download?
Unable to erase the selected range from the download because no part of the range is present.
Do you wish to cancel this download but save the incomplete files?
Download host %s does not have the file "%s".
Unable to create local file "%s" for download, aborting.
Unable to open local file "%s" for download, aborting.
No more download fragments, closing connection to %s.
Download host's eDonkey hashset is corrupt or internally inconsistent, dropping source.
Received an invalid eDonkey hashset from %s, dropping source.
Received eDonkey hashset for "%s", minimum verifiable chunk %s.
Unable to initialize inflate for download "%s".
Download host %s responded with an invalid HTTP response.
Download host %s is busy, waiting in queue at position #%i of %i ("%s").
Dropping download source %s for "%s" because queue position %i is too high.
Timed out waiting for queue update from eDonkey download host %s for file "%s".
Download request to %s timed out, closing connection.
Querying for more sources for download "%s" on %i connections...
Can't fetch more sources for download "%s" because there is no network connection.
Download host's tiger-tree data is corrupt or internally inconsistent, ignoring it.
Download host's tiger-tree does not match expected root value.
Download host %s could not satisfy the tiger-tree request.
Received tiger-tree volume for "%s", %i levels, minimum verifiable chunk %s.
Closing download connection %s due to lack of traffic.
Download host %s responded with a different, but useful range (%I64i-%I64i) of "%s".
Received an unnecessary push connection from %s.
Dropping source %s (%s) for sending corrupted parts of "%s" (%I64i-%I64i).
Warning: Download "%s" failed verification, it may not be the file you intended to download.
Download host %s's version of "%s" has a different URN, aborting.
Download host %s responded with a useless byte range of "%s", pending.
Download host %s's version of "%s" has a different length, aborting.
Host "%s" sent code 416, without providing available ranges. Closing connection.
Accepted an incoming connection from %s port %i.
Already connected to %s, will not establish a second connection.
Initiating a neighbor connection to %s port %i...
Established a connection with neighbor %s, handshaking...
Unable to initiate a neighbor connection with %s.
Closed connection with neighbor %s because it is not a hub.
Unable to initiate a neighbor connection with %s (refused).
Closing connection to neighbor %s due to lack of traffic.
Discovery service "%s" has failed %i times, removing.
Submitting GWebCache "%s" to a random GWebCache...
Incoming connection from %s is an eDonkey client link.
Received a malformatted eDonkey packet from %s (id=%x).
eDonkey client connection to %s was idle, closed.
Timed out connecting to eDonkey client %s.
Refusing eDonkey client link from %s because eDonkey is disabled.
eDonkey client connection to %s was closed.
Error exchanging handshake with eDonkey client %s.
Timed out handshaking with eDonkey client %s.
eDonkey client %s has the wrong GUID, aborting handshake.
This file is already in the Envy download list.
Insufficient disk space to copy download file.
Download data file is newer than .part file, aborting.
Process complete, %i partial downloads imported successfully.
Starting eDonkey partial download import process...
Initiating connection to eDonkey server at %s...
eDonkey server %s changed our client ID from %lu to %lu.
eDonkey server %s online, client ID is %lu.
Are you sure you wish to delete this filter ?
There already is a filter called "%s", do you want to replace it?
Please give your filter a name.
Connecting neighbor %s falling back to shielded leaf mode.
Closing surplus connection from %s with host hint (%s port %i).
Hub neighbor %s won't accept us as a hub, closing connection.
Handshake with %s failed due to invalid data on the wire.
Acting as a hub for leaf neighbor %s.
Hub connection established, closing peer connections.
Refusing connection from %s because this is a shielded leaf node.
Neighbor %s is not a hub, closing connection.
Neighbor %s wants to be a hub, closing connection.
Gnutella connection with neighbor %s established successfully (G%i.%i : %s).
Gnutella2 connection with neighbor %s established successfully (%s).
Envy is creating hashes for %Iu files:
Please respect others while using this service. Press Connect below to start.
Welcome to the Envy IRC Chatrooms
Envy was unable to install the collection file "%s" by copying it to the folder "%s".
Would you like to download all files in this collection?\n\nChoose Cancel to stop any further prompts.
Envy has added the collection file "%s" to your library.

Envy received a collection file:

"%s"

This file does not appear to be a valid collection file.
Would you like to prevent this collection from prompting you to download anything else?
Are you sure you want to launch the file "%s" ?\n\nSome files can be harmful to your computer. Ensure you know what the file is before launching it.
Are you sure you want to delete the %i selected album folders ?\n\nNote that this action does not delete the files within the album folders, only the folders themselves.
Envy could not delete the file:\n\n%s

Your downloaded files folder "%s" is not yet in your library.

Including your downloaded files folder in your library makes it easier to view and organize new downloads, and lets you take advantage of advanced Envy features such as download verification and automatic upgrading. Placing downloaded files in your library does not necessarily require you to share them: you can choose whether or not to share files independently.

Would you like to add your downloaded files folder to your library now?
Your downloads folder has been added to your library. Would you like to share it too?
Add this folder to your Library?\n\n%s
You are about to modify the metadata of %i files, are you sure you want to continue?
Unable to move the file %s. The file may be in use by another application.\n\nDo you wish to try to copy this file instead?

Target file exists:

%s

Would you like to overwrite it?
The file "%s" failed a hash verification test, and might not be the file you intended to download. Are you sure you want to open it?
Would you like to remove the "potentially unsafe" attribute from this file?

A subfolder of the selected folder "%s" is already part of your library.
Adding this folder will cause re-hashing of some files.

Do you want to continue ?
There is no file playing. Double-click a media file in your library to play it.

All Media Files|*.asx;*.wax;*.m3u;*.wvx;*.wmx;*.asf;*.wav;*.snd;*.au;*.aif;*.aifc;*.aiff;*.wma;*.rm;*.mp3;*.ogg;*.ogm;*.cda;*.mid;*.rmi;*.midi;*.avi;*.asf;*.mpeg;*.mpg;*.m1v;*.mp2;*.mpa;*.mpe;*.wmv|Playlists|*.asx;*.wax;*.m3u;*.wvx;*.wmx|Audio Files|*.asf;*.wav;*.snd;*.au;*.aif;*.aifc;*.aiff;*.wma;*.rm;*.mp3;*.ogg;*.ogm|Video Files|*.avi;*.asf;*.mpeg;*.mpg;*.m1v;*.mp2;*.mpa;*.mpe;*.wmv|CD Audio Tracks|*.cda|MIDI Files|*.mid;*.rmi;*.midi|All Files|*.*||
The file may be damaged, or you may not have the necessary codecs to play it.
Part of this file could not be played, you may need to download additional codecs.
Envy could not instantiate its MediaServices plugin. Please reinstall Envy, and confirm that you have the necessary media codecs and output drivers installed.

You haven't entered your location in your user profile.

It's a good idea to enter your location so that other users can see which country you are from. Note that entering a location does not reveal any compromising information.

Are you sure you want to continue without entering your location?
You haven't entered a screen name in your user profile.
You have not selected your age and gender. Are you sure you want to continue without doing this?
Click the Connect button to get started.
You're not connected to the network.
Are you sure you want to disconnect?
G2 (Gnutella2) is Envy's premiere network. Disabling support for it may limit features and the quality of your search results. Are you sure you wish to do this?
Can't bind to %s port %i for incoming connections. Incoming connections will not be supported.
Can't resolve %s for outgoing connections. Outgoing connections will use the default interface.
Your outgoing bandwidth is too low to enable this network
Firewalled, not listening for incoming connections.

Forcing your PC into hub mode may have adverse effects on performance and the P2P network. It is generally better to allow Envy to decide whether or not hub mode should be used.

Hub mode does not produce better search results, or have any other advantages for you.

Are you certain you wish to do this, despite the disadvantages?
Accepting incoming TCP connections on %s port %i.
Listening for UDP datagrams on %s port %i.
Outgoing connections will be from %s port %i.
Address %s is already blocked by your security rules.
You are running the Scheduler in 'G2 only' mode. Would you like to turn this mode off, so that all active networks remain connected?
UPnP port mapping failed after 10 attempts.
Ignoring malformatted query hit packet from %s.
Ignoring malformatted %s search query packet from %s.
Neighbor %s forwarded a packet with excessive TTL, dropping packet (TTL=%i, Hops=%i).
Neighbor %s forwarded an extended packet that is not GGEP encoded.
Neighbor %s sent an invalid query routing table update, dropping connection.
Sending query routing table to neighbor %s (%i bit = %lu[%i], %i%% full)
Receiving an unexpected query routing table update from neighbor %s.
Neighbor %s updated its query routing table (%i bit = %lu[%i], %i%% full).
Leaf neighbor %s is forwarding queries, dropping connection.
Neighbor %s forwarded a %s packet with invalid length, ignoring.
Neighbor %s forwarded a packet of excessive size, dropping connection.
Received a packet from %s for %s which exceeds query limits, ignoring.
Neighbor %s forwarded an unrecognised packet (0x%.2x), ignoring.
Neighbor %s forwarded a pong with invalid address data, ignoring.
Neighbor %s forwarded a push request to a firewalled address, ignoring.
Are you sure you wish to delete selected security rules?

Last number is 254,252,248,240,224,192,128, or 0. Others must be 255.

(For Netmasked IP ranges.)

See getenvy.com/wiki for help.
Are you sure you wish to remove all scheduled tasks?\n\nThis cannot be undone.
Scheduled time has passed. Please select a new time.
No scheduled day. Select one or more days or date.
No scheduled event. Please select a task.
Envy is actively searching the network...
You are about to start a new search. Would you like to clear the results of your previous search?
This area shows more information about files you select.
Unable to download preview content from "%s".
The network has not returned any matches yet.
Some results are available, but were filtered out.
No searches have been started in this window yet.
Type some keywords to search for:
Look for this type of file:
%lu file in %lu hit|%lu file in %lu hits|%lu files in %lu hits
The complete and incomplete folders should not be the same
Windows doesn't support paths longer than 256 characters.\nPlease select a folder with a shorter path.
The incomplete files folder should not be in the library, as it would reduce performance. Incomplete files may be shared directly from the transfers window.
Please type the bandwidth limit you wish to set in the form "123 kb/s" for kilobits per second, or "123 KB/s" for kilobytes per second.

The eDonkey network uses large queues with long wait times. By limiting the maximum queue position you will accept so strictly, you may have trouble getting downloads to begin.\nAre you sure you want to limit what queue positions you will accept?
Unable to accept connections, URL unavailable.
Are you sure you wish to delete the "%s" skin? This cannot be undone.
Failed to load Library metadata schemas. Please reinstall application. Continue loading?
Connected to %lu neighbors. %s in local library.
Hub mode with %lu neighbors. %s in local library.
Hub/Ultrapeer mode with %lu neighbors. %s in local library.
Ultrapeer mode with %lu neighbors. %s in local library.
!Welcome to {version}\n\nEnvy is completely free software, please use it responsibly.
There are no active searches. Click here to search for files.
You're not connected. Click the Connect button to get started.
Are you sure you want to delete the "%s" template?\nThis cannot be undone.
This file appears to be spam.
You have downloaded and deleted this file before.
You already have this file on your download list.
You already have this file in your library.
Sources for this file are currently busy
Sources for this file are firewalled
Sources for this file may be unstable
Envy has finished downloading the next Envy version (%s). Would you like to upgrade now?\n\nIf you select Yes, Envy will close temporarily while the upgrade is installed.
Sending default HTML response to upload host %s (%s).
Incoming connection from %s is a HTTP upload request.
Upload host %s (%s) sent a browse user request, responding...
Upload host %s is on the user-agent block list, denying request.
Refusing browse user request from %s, too many browse connections.
Queued upload %s is re-requesting too fast, closing connection.
Refusing upload of "%s" to %s (%s), too many concurrent from host.
Refusing upload of "%s" to %s (%s), busy and client does not support queues.
Refusing upload of "%s" to %s (%s), all matching queues are full.
Upload host %s requested an unsatisfiable range of file "%s".
eDonkey uploads should not be cancelled. Are you sure you want to cancel this upload?
Can't open "%s" to upload to host %s, disk/file error.
Unable to connect to host %s for push.
Sending upload content range %I64i-%I64i from "%s" to host %s (%s).
Refusing new upload to %s because an earlier connection is still pending.
Closing older upload to %s because it has made a fresh connection.
Stopped uploading "%s" to %s because the file was deleted.
Upload host %s requested unknown or unavailable object "%s".
Push connection to %s established, waiting for handshake...
Upload host %s requested "%s" with different SHA1.
Sending upload headers from "%s" to host %s (%s).
Upload host %s sent an invalid HTTP request.
Sending upload content range %I64i-%I64i from partial file "%s" to host %s (%s).
Refusing to upload a preview of "%s" to %s, too many preview connections.
Scheduling a dynamic preview of "%s" for upload to %s.
Upload host %s requested a preview of "%s", but no preview is available.
Refusing push request to %s because it has too many upload connections.
Too busy to upload "%s" to %s, queued at #%i of %i ("%s").
Upload connection to %s was lost, preserving queue position.
Offline queued upload host %s expired, removing.
Timed out waiting for request from upload host %s.
Closing upload connection %s due to lack of traffic.
Unable to parse URL: Envy does not understand this URL.
UPnP Device Host Service is not running. This service is required to perform the setup.\nYou need to set the startup type of the service to automatic.
Changing view will close any windows you have open. Would you like to change now?
Changing interface direction requires restart.\n\nExit now?
Please wait: Updating eDonkey server list...
You have not yet specified a connection speed. Before continuing, please either choose your Internet connection type, or type in a connection speed.
The folder you are sharing is already shared as part of another shared folder:\n\n%s
You have not specified any folders to share. Are you sure?

control.text: Show a dialog when opening links
Switch to Transfers view on download
Hide side bar when starting search
Ask Me|Minimize to Taskbar|Hide to Tray|Exit After Downloads|Exit Immediately
Use Envy Media Player to PLAY file types listed below
Use Envy Media Player to ENQUEUE file types listed below
Note: For playback problems, install an updated 'Codec Pack' (Try Codecs.com)
Enable peer-to-peer messaging with compatible clients
Enable chat over other protocols where possible
Use your G2/Gnutella User Profile to share basic information about yourself, or recommend files and links to others.
Remote Access allows you to leave Envy running on your PC, and control it remotely using any web browser. {n}You must be able to accept incoming connections. (Port-forwarding)
Use Envy to open these types of links:
Use Envy to manage all my web downloads:
The download manager plugin will only attempt to download file types listed here. Other file types will be handled by your web browser. Envy must be running to manage downloads.
Only download/upload with networks that are currently connected.

Envy is a general-purpose file-sharing application that can utilize several P2P networks simultaneously. On this page you can select which P2P networks you want to connect to, and then adjust specific settings for each network.
The G2 network is Envy's premiere protocol, offering more features and performance than any other P2P net. (Shareaza)
The original Gnutella network is less feature-rich than G2, and returns search spam, yet remains a valuable resource. (Limewire)
The eDonkey network is a popular server-based network. Not as feature-rich or fast as G2, but ED2K has an impressive size. (eMule)
The DC++ network is a community hub-based network. (DC++)
Search known remote servers in the server cache:
Update global server list from the connected server
Update eDonkey server list from the web. (MET file)
DC++ works by connecting to specific "hub" communities. Please select hubs from the "Hostcache" advanced view window (F8), otherwise one will be randomly selected.
Update DC++ hubs from the web. (hublist.xml.bz2)
Enable EndGame mode when completing torrents (multi-source)
Clear downloaded torrents when share ratio reaches:
This QuickStart wizard can help configure the software in a few simple steps, even if you haven't used Envy or other P2P client before.
More advanced users can access the full range of Envy's options via the Tools menu. Click Exit at any time to leave the wizard.
This wizard will assist you to:
Tell Envy about your Internet connection
Connect to your choice of P2P networks
Choose which files to share, and
For best performance, Envy needs to know your internet connection.
You may select the Internet connection type:
| Dial-up Modem| ISDN 128K| DSL 768K| DSL 1.5| Cable 3| DSL 4| DSL2 8| FIOS 10| DSL2 12| FIOS 15| FIOS 20| FIOS 25| FIOS 30| FIOS 50| T1| T3| LAN| OC3
Envy is a general purpose filesharing application that can swarm multiple P2P networks on a single download, therefore all are recommended. Note you can always manage specific networks at any time.
The Gnutella2 network (G2) is Envy's premiere network, offering more features and performance than any other P2P net. (Shareaza)
The original Gnutella network (G1) is less feature-rich than G2, with more unwanted spam, yet remains a valuable resource. (LimeWire)
The eDonkey network (ED2K) is a popular server-based network. While not as feature-rich or fast as G2, ED2K has a vast file collection. (eMule)
Envy first downloads partial files to a private folder, then moves them when completed according to Download Groups.
Save Complete files here by default:
Common filetypes are initially setup as subfolders of the default location, but Groups can easily be customized by Right-Click. Simply Drag'n'Drop files.
P2P networks are only as good as the people who use them:{n}Anything available for download is being shared by another user like you.
You do not need to share any files to use Envy, however your downloading performance may be restricted by other users. Be polite.
First use the Add button to include folders in your local libray, then click the checkboxes to publicly share or hide them. Files can be unshared later.
Caution: Uploading unauthorized copyright works is liable in some countries.
Envy supports a flexible user interface, so you can choose what is most comfortable for you. You can change these options at any time.
Standard view offers all available commands, windows, abilities.
Simple, easy to use menus with fewer options. Limited for new users.
Display simple download progress bars. (Less detail)
Full selection in Settings, try mixing various skins.
Almost done. Filesharing is friendlier when everyone shares a few basic details about themselves. Full profile is available from the Tools menu.
That's it. Envy has been configured to work with your computer.
If you ever need to change these settings, re-run the QuickStart wizard by selecting it from the Tools menu.
After closing this Wizard, the first thing to do is run a 'fake' random search to catch spammers and Ban them all. Explore toolbar tabs while waiting.
Start Envy every time Windows starts
Connect to networks when Envy starts
And thanks. {n}Enjoy using Envy for all your peer-to-peer networking needs.
Envy has detected that you have another eDonkey program installed on your computer. Would you like to import any unfinished downloads into Envy?
This profile is available to users who browse your files, primarily on the G2 network.{n}(Envy or Shareaza)
Allow others to browse my user profile
Other users browsing your profile and shared files will see your avatar. Custom avatars should be 128x128 pixels, and can be in any supported image file on your PC.
Favorite files are recommended to users who browse your profile. Create favorite files by adding them to the "Favorites" library folder.

Users are identified by a globally unique identifier and a corresponding public and private key pair. Normally there is no need to use or generate a new ID, however this option is provided for advanced users.
Initiate a new connection to host or server:|Browse this host:|Message this user:
New files can be downloaded directly from Web and P2P links. Simply copy/paste the URL or URI link for the file into the box below. (http:, ftp:, ed2k:, magnet:, etc.)
A small .torrent file is needed to begin BitTorrent downloads. Paste the .torrent's direct link above, or select a local .torrent file. (Use drag'n'drop any time.)
Default sharing (when parent folder is shared)
Override default sharing for this file:
You have selected %i files to copy to the following folder:
You have selected %i files to move to the following folder:
Add this information to all files in the folder
Select a schema from the list, then select the fields to display as columns.

This is a list of folders in your personal library. {n}First add folders, then click the checkboxes to publicly share or hide them. Specific files and subfolders can be shared/unshared from the Library.
You can copy the P2P Link ('URI') for a selected item in various formats.{n}Simply click the format you wish to save to clipboard:
_Include myself as a fixed source in the URL
You have selected %lu files to export as Envy-powered URI references. Please select the format for the URIs, and click Save:
Tiger Root|SHA1|MD5|ED2K (MD4)|BitTorrent|Filename|Filename (URI)|Base Filename|File Extension|File Size|File Size (bytes)|Folder Path|Local Host|Local Port|Link|Link (URI)
You have clicked a Envy-powered URI that links to this content on the network:
You have clicked a Envy-powered URL that will connect you to this host or server:
You have clicked a Envy-powered URI that will allow you to browse the shared files available on the following host:
You have clicked a Envy-powered URI that will add this Discovery Service to your Discovery Services cache.
Select the action you would like to take:
Envy is attempting to download metadata from Bitprints...
Envy is creating a preview of the download:
(Copying downloaded chunks to a new preview file)
Did you know Envy is 100% free software?

Envy does not contain any spyware, adware or bundled software;{n}it does not display any advertisements, popups, or other bad behavior.{n}{n}If you ever see such activity be assured that it is not coming from a genuine version of this program.

Envy is proud to be Free and Open-Source Software. A non-profit team of passionate volunteers shares this product with all the freedoms of GPL and Creative Commons Licenses, in the hope that it might be useful.
You must not have paid any money to obtain this program. Envy can be freely downloaded from GetEnvy.com, if you've paid anyone for this demand a full refund immediately.
Envy respects and appreciates its users.
Hope you've enjoyed using Envy so far, it strives to be the best true file sharing software available.
Unfortunately, a lot of potential filesharers don't know what they're missing.
If you know someone who might like Envy, whether a new user or still using older software, let them know there is a better alternative. And Thanks.
(This is the last welcome message you will see.)
You already have this file in your file library. What would you like to do?
Show me the file in my library
You have downloaded and deleted this file before. What would you like to do?

Warning: Duplicate files detected. Some malicious software may infect your Library. Make sure that you downloaded this file or placed it manually. Otherwise, shutdown Envy and scan your computer with an antivirus program.
This is the first time you have clicked Envy's close button. Please choose what action you would like to take:
Hide to tray and shut down after downloads
You can download a file from the web to refresh your local list of servers.{n}Such as eDonkey server.met, DC++ hublist.xml.bz2, etc.
Envy can remember files to warn you and others in the future. A new 'ghost file' will save your comments and rating with file info.

Just deleting, keep any current comments|File is very low quality or outdated|File is named incorrectly or misleading|File is fake, infected, corrupt, or unusable|File is restricted copyright material|File needs custom comments below...
This feature is used to export the contents of a folder or playlist as a rich collection file. Please select a template and press Next to continue.|Customize your collection by entering data below.

Your downloaded files folder "%s" is not yet in your library.{n}{n}Including your downloaded files folder in your library makes it easier to view and organize new downloads, and lets you take advantage of advanced Envy features such as download verification and automatic upgrading. Placing downloaded files in your library does not necessarily require you to share them: you can choose whether or not to share files independently.{n}{n}Would you like to add your downloaded files folder to your library now?
You have opened a BitTorrent torrent file. Would you like to download its contents, or re-seed it?
To share complete files using BitTorrent they must first be seeded. Once this process is complete the Torrent will appear as a new item in your download list.
As needed| When ratio over 100%| Only when requested| Never
Caution: This dialog provides advanced download editing features for power users, that may cause corruption when used incorrectly.
Caution: This dialog provides advanced download editing features for power users, that may cause corruption when used incorrectly.
Forget current verification status and reverify
Assume file is 100% complete and reverify
Merge with local file and verify
Cancel download but save incomplete files
Select an audio visualization from the list:
Footer Display|Full Size Display|Large Display|Medium Display|Small Display
A new version of Envy is now available. Would you like to upgrade?
To update now, the upgrade installer will simply be added to your download queue.
Please select the method of re-encoding:
Add new channel to the list:|Enter kick/ban reason:
Envy™ is free software; you can redistribute and/or modify it{n}under terms of the GNU Affero General Public License as published{n}by the Free Software Foundation, version 3 or later. (AGPL v3)

skin.remote:
<tag id="text_welcome" text="Welcome to the Envy Remote Web Interface."/> <tag id="text_logininfo" text="If this is your Envy client's address, please enter your username and password, and click the Login button."/>
<tag id="text_networkdisabled" text="This network is not enabled"/>
<tag id="text_searchinfo" text="To start a new search, type your search term in the box below and click Start search. If you want to restrict your search to a particular file type, select it from the list (recommended)."/>
